channel.title: Comments on: Delayed Replication in MySQL 5.6 Development Release
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../delayed-replication-in-mysql-5-6-development-release/index.html#comment-451">Sanjeev</a>.
In general, we don't retrofit new features to GA releases (users don't want to have to retest their applications when there are new maintenance releases) and there are no plans to back-port delayed replication,
Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sanjeev.

In general, we don’t retrofit new features to GA releases (users don’t want to have to retest their applications when there are new maintenance releases) and there are no plans to back-port delayed replication,

Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Sanjeev
item.dc:creator: Sanjeev
item.description:
Hi
Right now i am using 5.5 version of MySQL. Currently this MASTER_DELAY option is available with 5.6 ...! .
So is there any possibility to make use of MASTER_DELAY command in version 5.5 ???
Please suggest me...
item.content:encoded:
Hi

Right now i am using 5.5 version of MySQL. Currently this MASTER_DELAY option is available with 5.6 …! .

So is there any possibility to make use of MASTER_DELAY command in version 5.5 ???

Please suggest me…

item.title: By: Ricardo Vilhena
item.dc:creator: Ricardo Vilhena
item.description:
Hello Andrew.
First of all I apologise for making questions in you won blog. But I'm really stuck here with a problem which I think you can help me!
I've installed mysql cluster and it's all running smoothly (1 manage server and 2 data nodes).
I'm trying to intall mysql-php in the data nodes so that I can user phpmyadmin but when I run yum install php-mysql.x86_64 I got the conflict error: MySQL-Cluster-gpl-server conflicts with mysql.
Are the not compatible? Because I reallu need the two of them.
Thanks.
Regards, Vilhena
item.content:encoded:
Hello Andrew.

First of all I apologise for making questions in you won blog. But I’m really stuck here with a problem which I think you can help me!

I’ve installed mysql cluster and it’s all running smoothly (1 manage server and 2 data nodes).

I’m trying to intall mysql-php in the data nodes so that I can user phpmyadmin but when I run yum install php-mysql.x86_64 I got the conflict error: MySQL-Cluster-gpl-server conflicts with mysql.

Are the not compatible? Because I reallu need the two of them.

Thanks.

Regards,
Vilhena

item.title: By: Baron Schwartz
item.dc:creator: Baron Schwartz
item.description: This is great. It is currently available for all versions through Maatkit, but that is not as simple to use and inherently less reliable.
item.content:encoded: This is great. It is currently available for all versions through Maatkit, but that is not as simple to use and inherently less reliable.
